intro: Gomphostemma deltodon, commonly known as the heartleaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Menispermaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, arrowhead-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Gomphostemma deltodon thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
